message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: int[] scores = {10, 10, 20, 40};
Map<Integer, List<Integer>> scoreMap = new HashMap<>();
for (int i = 0; i < scores.length; i++) {
    int score = scores[i];
    if (!scoreMap.containsKey(score)) {
        scoreMap.put(score, new ArrayList<>());
    }
    scoreMap.get(score).add(i);
}

int[] ranking = new int[scores.length];
int rank = 1;
for (int score : scoreMap.keySet()) {
    List<Integer> indices = scoreMap.get(score);
    for (int index : indices) {
        ranking[index] = rank;
    }
    rank += indices.size();
}

System.out.println(Arrays.toString(ranking));
<<<explanation>>>: This code creates a map where the keys are the scores and the values are lists of indices. It then iterates over the map and assigns the ranks to the corresponding indices in the ranking array. The rank is incremented by the size of the list of indices for each score.
